Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees are battling the Baltimore Orioles for first place in the American League East.
The Yankees need their hitters to continue raking at the plate and give them the best chance to win.
Anthony Volpe has been solid as the leadoff hitter this season in New York.
Juan Soto has been a welcome addition to the Bronx Bombers.
Aaron Judge is one of the best hitters in baseball.
Schmidt is returning from a months-long injury.
The Yankees don't have a fixed closer after Clay Holmes recently blew his 11th save of the season.
The Cubs are not technically dead yet and will have 21 games to make up the difference in a mad scramble to make the playoffs.
Nico Hoerner has been steady when he has been available.
Ian Happ has already passed 80 RBIs and 80 runs and will look to drive more in.
Assad has had two straight quality starts and will take on a high-powered Yankees lineup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees are 73-67 against the run line, while the Cubs are 68-72.
The Yanks are 42-30 against the run line on the road, while the Cubs are only 25-43 against the run line at Wrigley Field.
The Yankees are predicted to win this game and cover the run line.
Others: The final prediction and pick is the New York Yankees -1.5 (+125)
